headline: Moscow Mule Cocktail
description: This classic Moscow mule recipe combines vodka, ginger beer, lime juice, and ice to create a refreshing and spicy festive drink or summer cooler!

video.description: A thoroughly refreshing vodka, lime juice, and ginger beer cocktail.
video.name: Moscow Mule Cocktail

name: Moscow Mule Cocktail

recipeInstructions.text: Pour vodka and lime juice into a mug; add ice cubes and ginger beer. Stir to combine.
Drop a lime wedge into the mug for garnish.

review.reviewBody: Good enoughüëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª
We totally loved these especially my hubby! I also like it with Diet Ginger beer to keep my carbs!
First one was okay, then I tried with a bit extra vodka, and some pineapple juice and some orange juice, turned out amazing.
Very tasty -- used Stoli vodka and their (Polish) ginger beer, excellent.
I thought it was very good
I enjoyed it! The only vodka we had was ‚Äúwhipping cream‚Äù flavored, but I think it gave it a touch of sweetness, which was a nice change.
Refreshing and very drinkable!!!
I made it bigger...didn't quite double recipe. Thank you for posting this recipe. I missed the mint but can add another time.
No ; I just think it sounded fine .

This is a great no-brainer recipe for a Moscow mule. One comment though, the video made me cringe. DO NOT scoop ice with glass. That's a no-no. Also, Moscow mules are served in copper mugs not pint glasses.
simple and delicious. a refreshing adult beverage.
Love how simple the recipe and proportions are. A great cocktail.
Tastes just like the ones you get at out at the bar!
Maybe add a bit of simple syrup

I love Moscow Mules! When I stopped drinking surgery carbohydrated drinks I switched to a diet ginger ale for making my Moscow Mules. Still tastes great as long as you keep the lime juice and vodka measurements the same.

So awesome! I doubled the recipe and added an ounce of simple syrup since I like my drinks slightly sweeter. I used a bottle of feverfew ginger beer as recommended by other commenters and it worked great.
So refreshing!! Love making these drinks
No changes. Yum!
Delicious. Perfect balance of vodka, lime juice and ginger beer. Saved to my favorites.
I used Lemons instead of Lime (I didn‚Äôt have lime). Then added cucumbers (I muddled them in my mug). Yum!
Everyone loved it and it was so simple!!
So good!
Turned out great!
Just like a restaurant. I need to find better ginger beer. I used Goslings and it wasn‚Äôt spicy enough
Made the simple syrup one reviewer suggested and added 2 tsp. Doubled the lime.
Love this bevy! :)
Do use freshly squeezed lime. Used Tito‚Äôs. Tried many ginger beers and liked Fentimen‚Äôs best. Fever Tree also nice.

It was a little sweeter than I wanted. But good!
Going to find a less-sweet ginger beer next time (maybe syrup)
Love this cocktail. I use New Amsterdam or Absolut and a real ginger beer or brew I get at a distributor.
I loved it the only difference I didn't have lime juice so are used margarita mix instead it turned out really good I made a second drink for later and I will make it again thank you for the recipe
Real easy & delicious.
Totally delighful!
Absolutely delicious. These buggers will creep up on you though.
Used Titos & fever tree beer also which has a little more spice but it was tasty and these things can creep up on you.
The best drink I ever had! Highly recommend to anyone, 5/5
I changed up for holiday and used cranberry vodka and garnished with sugared cranberries
Using Jamaican ginger beer made it particularly spicy and delicious. Quick to make, one serving at a time. Very original drink.
Tastes great.
Made exactly as recipe. So refreshing! Used Barritt‚Äôs Bermuda ginger beer. Excellent flavor.
have made these 100's of times over the years and this is an excellent recipe‚Ä¶ defnietely must be served in the copper mugs‚Ä¶ refrigerate (or freeze) mugs ahead of time! YUM
No changes and the crowd really enjoyed them.

I made the Moscow Mule according to the recipe. This drink is a little too sweet for my taste but that is personal preference. If ones likes drinks with carbonated beverages, I would recommend giving this a try!
Delicious! Better than going out any day!
Good drink! I used sweetened lime juice, Crabbies alcoholic ginger beer and added mint leaves.
Fabulous. Add a splash of aromatic bitters. Gives it a perfect finish.

I use different ginger beers, but I‚Äôve found that one of the cheaper ones - Citadelle - is one of the best and has a nice amount of carbonation. I tend to substitute bourbon (Kentucky Mule) or rye in place of the vodka. You can use any liquor, really. Mezcal mules are great, too!
Pretty darn tasty

Oooooh weeeee!!!! Dat gumbo wuz gooood!!!!! I make a chicken and sausage gumbo that is equally as good as this recipe that includes seafood. Made this for my son for his birthday and he loved it! Will definitely make this again!!! Thanks for sharing your family recipe! I look forward to having it tomorrow. It‚Äôs always better the next day and I can‚Äôt imagine it being any better than it already is. Be sure to make the roux dark as this is the secret to a good gumbo!
Easy and delicious! Made with Grey Goose, Gosling‚Äôs ginger beer, a squeeze of fresh lime and lots of ice.
Easy and delicious! Made with Grey Goose, Gosling‚Äôs ginger beer, a squeeze of fresh lime and lots of ice.
I followed the recipe and they turned out fantastic!
Very good! We had trouble finding ginger beer, so we made it with ginger ale instead. The colder the better! Goes down very easy! Best summer drink that doesn't require a blender!
These are so easy and go down too easy. For those who said they goofed and got hard ginger beer...the only one like that is Crabbies! That is good but, not for this drink. Haha!
I use Crabby's alcoholic ginger beer, it adds just the right amount of ginger flavor. Very simple, very good.
Yummy and very refreshing! Super easy to make.
So. Good. I love lime juice and squeezed a whole lime into the drink (almost 2 oz), which is probably a horrible idea because now I'm going to continue gulping these down!
I used raspberry ginger beer for a yummy change of taste
I added a tad of maple syrup. My local bar makes a version using vanilla vodka, and maple liquor-I want to replicate if I can. Still very yummy!
Best recipe I have tried. Excellent!
Loved it! Very refreshing! Great summer drink or anytime drink! Used a little less lime and put a slice of gringer in it!
I served this as a "speciality" drink and gave them to guests as they arrived. All loved them and wanted the recipe.

You don't have to chill the copper mugs, they'll get and keep cold when you fill them with ice cubes. I used the 1/2 cup (4 ounces) of Crabbie's Orginal Alcoholic Ginger Beer and all the other ingredients but added one more: 1 tsp of 'simple syrup' which I made by using a 1:1 ratio of water and sugar (1/4 cup water to 1/4 cup sugar or any equal amounts you choose) then microwaving in a glass bowl (NOT in the copper mugs!) 
 and stirring it to dissolve the sugar. The left over simple syrup should be sealed tightly and refrigerated to be used for other recipes within a week. Adding the sugar makes this a 5-star recipe as it tempers the sour/acid of the lime a bit.
This is the perfect summertime cocktail!! It's refreshing and actually quenches your thirst. Just remember to drink in moderation and enjoy!
Excellent! What a difference in flavor depending on the brand of ginger beer, though!

My new favorite drink! If you like a ginger beer with lots of bite try fever tree ginger beer. It has cane sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup. I also use the Tito's vodka.. it has a very smooth finish. Yum!

To make the Teton Mule - that's higher in kick than a Moscow Mule, add 4 drops of bitters to the lime juice.

High altitude kick!
Great summer drink. Even better out of a copper mug. Amazon has some nice ones.
This recipe is pretty good.

Wonderful cocktail! I could only find Goya brand Jamaican style ginger beer, which is a bit spicy, but delightful. Rather than use fresh lime juice, I use Rose's Lime Juice, which is sweet, and float it on top. Served in my 30 year old roly poly copper tumblers! Awesome!
I decided to make this after a friend introduced me to the drink last week. I used Seagrams Vodka and Reeds extra ginger brew. Delicious!
Used a great ginger beer, which think was most important to t he taste. Proportions of ingredients was perfect!
Warning! These are way, way too good. They go down so very smoothly. Use caution!
I used Diet Ginger Beer and it was still good. I bought a couple of cheap copper mugs just for this drink; which made it more fun.

We used Smirnoff Vodka and Not Your Father's Ginger Ale. Wow, just wow. These were very tasty and VERY potent (probably due to the fact that I accidentally got hard ginger ale instead of ginger beer). The perfect recipe the new copper cups the hubs got for our 7th anniversary :)
Fresh and good
Added a little more lime and really enjoyed this cocktail served in copper mug
I accidentally made it with rum...oops! But it was the clear kind, and it actually tastes pretty good. Can't wait to try it with vodka!
Perfect icy cold summer drink! Probably pretty healthy too with the ginger, citrus lime, and no added sugar :-)
It's good with blenheim ginger ale, if you don't have a ginger beer. I also enjoy it with Tito's vodka bc it has sweet finish and it's made in the US.
Sooo good!

Not QUITE as tasty in paper cups as in copper mugs, but still a pretty great way to end the work week and kick off a weekend. We used Bundaberg ginger beer. It's wodka (with a W, as my grandpa would say) with a kick!
Favorite summer drink!

The brand / quality of ginger beer makes a big difference. With a 'spicy' to balanced ginger beer, I like to add a splash of simple syrup. I really like Bundaberg, or Seattle's Rachel's Ginger Beer. You can skip the syrup if you pick a sweeter ginger brew.

Fill your cocktail shaker with a handful of ice, pour in your favorite vodka, slice and squeeze the lime right in there, add the splash of simple syrup, and shake away. Pour the chilled / strained mix into your copper mug (but a glass timber can suffice), then top it with cold ginger beer and serve.
Use premium Russian vodka, and there's your Moscow. Deliciously dangerous.
Very good balance of sweet, sour, spicy (and boozy)! Watch out though...they go down too easy!
